name: Domestic R&D paid for by the company and others and performed by the company, by industry, company size, and domestic R&D program size: 2020
description: Domestic R&D paid for by the company and others and performed by the company, by industry, company size, and domestic R&D program size: 2020

creator.name: National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics

variableMeasured.name: field_r_d_program_size_all_companies
variableMeasured.description: R D Program Size All Companies

variableMeasured.name: field_r_d_program_size_less_than_1_million
variableMeasured.description: R D Program Size Less Than 1 Million

variableMeasured.name: field_r_d_program_size_1_million_9_999_million
variableMeasured.description: R D Program Size 1 Million 9 999 Million

variableMeasured.name: field_r_d_program_size_10_million_49_999_million
variableMeasured.description: R D Program Size 10 Million 49 999 Million

variableMeasured.name: field_r_d_program_size_50_million_99_999_million
variableMeasured.description: R D Program Size 50 Million 99 999 Million

variableMeasured.name: field_r_d_program_size_100_million_or_more
variableMeasured.description: R D Program Size 100 Million Or More

specialValues.D: suppressed to avoid disclosure of confidential information

notes: Detail may not add to total because of rounding. Industry classification is based on the dominant business code for domestic R&D performance, where available. For companies that did not report business codes, the classification used for sampling was assigned. Statistics are representative of companies located in the United States that performed or funded $50,000 or more of R&D and are not comparable with estimates published for years prior to 2018. R&D program size classifications are based on R&D performance. An estimate range may be displayed in place of a single estimate to avoid disclosing operations of individual companies.
sources: National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics and Census Bureau, Business Enterprise Research and Development Survey, 2020.
